trans0565: Let's check things out. This could take a minute or two.
trans0571:
#### Internet disconnected, please confirm the ethernet cable is connected properly to the WAN port
- Connect an ethernet cable to the red WAN port on your Prism router

- Connect the other side to your PoE brick or NBN modem/NTD.
trans0574:
#### Internet connection test failed, here are some possible reasons:
- Incorrect username or password, please check and make sure these match exactly the details provided to you
- The ethernet cable may not be seated correctly or may have come loose
- You may need to wait a moment for any current PPPoE sessions to time-out
- Your NBN NTD or Fixed Wireless radio may not be powered on.
- For further advice and assistance, please reach out to our friendly, local support team.
trans0577: Failed to get a PPPoE username and password
trans0579:
#### Possible reasons why latency has been affected:
- Something on your network may be using a lot of bandwidth
- For further advice and information, please reach out to Pentanet support
trans0583: This function is not available when the Prism is set to Bridge mode.
trans0584:
#### DNS failure
- Please go to "Internet Settings" and make sure DNS is set to Auto. If in doubt, please reach out to our friendly support team.
trans0585:
#### There can be lots of reasons for an unexpected download result
- Another device on your network could be using a lot of bandwith
- The test server may be far away, or under heavy demand
- Variables such as overall network load
- Note that bandwidth tests performed in this way may use test server locations that are non-optimal, resulting in inconsistent or inaccurate results. The results provided here are best used as a guide only.
- For further support and advice, please reach out to our friendly support team.
trans0593: The location permission is needed to obtain the currently connected Wi-Fi SSID in order to automatically configure your Prism router.
trans0595:
- Wi-Fi signals will be weakened by concrete walls, floors, metal and glass. More mesh nodes are needed if you need more Wi-Fi coverage, for example in outdoor environment, balcony, and houses. 

- Please follow the guide below to get the best Wi-Fi signal: The equipment should be placed in the middle of the area as much as possible, open and unobstructed as much as possible, and positioned higher in the room rather than the lower to obtain better coverage; try to stay away from the microwave ovens, 2.4GHz devices such as wireless mice, wireless phones or other electrical appliances that use the 2.4GHz band.

- Please make sure the Wi-Fi signal is covered within the places you use Wi-Fi the most, like the living room, home office and bedroom; if the signal is weak, please adjust the distance between the mesh node and the main unit or add more nodes to get a better network experience.
